intro: Prangos odontalgica, commonly known as the toothache plant, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its common name, it has a long history of use in traditional medicine for its purported pain-relieving properties.
